[Waterproofing Wax](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1012)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Catalyst" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=396" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 169 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Price** 10 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="" /><row>Cast a Spell</row></row>

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Many books and spellbooks are treated in this wax formula to protect them from the elements, but _waterproofing wax's_ liquid-repellent properties can be further applied to split up a [_grease_](/Spells.aspx?ID=140) spell into useful smaller sections. When the spell is cast in an area while using this catalyst, the conjured grease fills three 5-foot squares within 30 feet instead of its normal area; these squares don't need to be contiguous.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Waterproofing Wax
